xxl.core.spatial.points

Class NumberPoint<T extends Number>

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.spatial.points.AbstractPoint
      • xxl.core.spatial.points.NumberPoint<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, Convertable, Point, DistanceTo<Point>

    public class NumberPoint<T extends Number>
extends AbstractPoint
implements Convertable, Cloneable
    A Wrapper for Number[]-points that provides useful methods on points like e.g. a conversion mechanism.
    See Also:
    Convertable, Point, Points, AbstractPoint, Serialized Form

      • read

        public void read(DataInput dataInput)
          throws IOException
        Reads the state (the attributes) for an object of this class from the specified data input and restores the calling object. The state of the object before calling read will be lost.
        The read method must read the values in the same sequence and with the same types as were written by write.
        Specified by:
        read in interface Convertable
        Specified by:
        read in interface Point
        Specified by:
        read in class AbstractPoint
        Parameters:
        dataInput - the stream to read data from in order to restore the object.
        Throws:
        IOException - if I/O errors occur.

      • write

        public void write(DataOutput dataOutput)
           throws IOException
        Writes the state (the attributes) of the calling object to the specified data output. This method should serialize the state of this object without calling another write method in order to prevent recursions.
        Specified by:
        write in interface Convertable
        Specified by:
        write in interface Point
        Specified by:
        write in class AbstractPoint
        Parameters:
        dataOutput - the stream to write the state (the attributes) of the object to.
        Throws:
        IOException - includes any I/O exceptions that may occur.
